page.title: 16WILLEN PRIORY MILTON KEYNES
page.content: In Willen Priory's library there is the greatest number of religious books in the whole of Milton Keynes. The oldest book there is called Rituale Graecorum and it was published in 1647, it was written in Greek and Latin. Willen Priory library is a very popular place and a lot of people come to borrow the books. Near the library is a building called the workshop where people come to have meetings and discussions. Some of the people come to the meetings from as far afield as London and Oxford. In the grounds there are vegetable patches; the Priory grows much of its own food. There are about 3 to 5 acres of grounds. There are 19 people living at the Priory but it can house up to 29 people. The Priory is near Willen Lake and Church. To get to the church you cross a road and follow a small path.
